objectives: Students will discuss family and relationships using Informal/Conversational register language
Students will engage with Drama themed scenarios related to family and relationships
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of informal level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining family and relationships content with Drama narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore family and relationships through a Drama lens using Informal/Conversational language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a dramatic conflict or emotional crisis involving family and relationships

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice informal register vocabulary related to family and relationships in a drama context
Students engage in drama themed role-play about family and relationships using informal register
Students create original drama themed content about family and relationships in informal register

discussion_questions: How would you describe family and relationships in a Drama scenario?
What conflict or tension might be involved in family and relationships?
Can you create a Drama story about family and relationships?
How does family and relationships change when viewed through a Drama perspective?
What informal register expressions would you use to discuss this drama scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Drama situation involving family and relationships
roles: Character A: Using informal register in drama context
Character B: Responding in informal register within drama theme

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Informal/Conversational throughout: Friendly, relaxed everyday speech
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Drama theme: Intense emotions, conflicts, life challenges

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Informal/Conversational register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Drama themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of informal register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
